articles.title: Holiday shoppers look to new gift giving trends
articles.description: Last year, Americans spent up to $16 billion on unwanted gifts. As a result, one in three consumers plan to give “experiences” instead of traditional presents.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Jonestown massacre 40 years later: Shooting survivor speaks out
articles.description: More than 900 people died in the Jonestown massacre after following cult leader Jim Jones to South America. Rep. Jackie Speier, then 28 and working for Rep. Leo Ryan, was shot and left for dead while there on a fact-finding mission.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: North Korea claims it has tested new ‘ultramodern’ weapon
articles.description: The country did not show the “tactical” and “ultramodern” weapon, instead sharing images of Kim Jong Un at the test site. U.S. officials say they don’t see the test as “provocative.”

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: DeVos proposes changes to the way colleges handle complaints of sexual misconduct
articles.description: Among the changes, Education Secretary Betsy DeVos is proposing a plan where schools would be required to investigate every formal complaint but only if the incident occurs on campus or at a school program, and only if reported to certain campus officials.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Justice Dept files undisclosed criminal charges against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange
articles.description: The charges were accidentally revealed when a prosecutor in Virginia, in an unrelated court filing, asked for documents to remain under seal “until Assange is arrested”.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: More than 600 missing in Northern California wildfire
articles.description: Search teams are combing through Paradise, California as the list of those unaccounted for has soared to more than 600. At least 63 people have died.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Winter storm causes commuter chaos, catches millions off guard
articles.description: Snow and traffic built up before plows could get on the road, leaving cars at a standstill, commuters stuck on buses for hours and hundreds of delays and cancellations at airports.

articles.description: The chance of an armed, foreign invasion on U.S. soil is super slim. But if one of our NATO allies goes to war, we do too. NBC News Foreign Correspondent Lucy Kafanov visited Norway for the largest NATO military exercise since the end of the Cold War.
